title: N001: Chart scaffold with Chart.yaml, values.yaml, and helpers
description:
**Size:** üèóÔ∏è large
**Category:** infrastructure
**Priority:** critical
**Source:** Proposed for 'Helm Chart Packaging

Chart structure under charts/'

Create the Helm chart foundation under charts/memcached-operator/. Includes: Chart.yaml (type: application, appVersion tracking operator version), comprehensive values.yaml with all tunables (image.repository/tag, replicaCount, resources, webhook.enabled, certmanager.enabled, serviceMonitor.enabled, networkPolicy.enabled, watchNamespaces, leaderElection.enabled, rbac.create, crds.managedByHelm), and templates/_helpers.tpl with standard label/name/selector helpers matching existing app.kubernetes.io/name conventions from config/. Also includes the CRD in crds/ directory (copied from config/crd/bases/) plus the optional templates/crd-template.yaml gated by crds.managedByHelm for helm-upgrade-managed CRD updates.

**Rationale:** Foundation that all other features depend on. The values.yaml defines the contract for all templates, _helpers.tpl provides reusable template functions, and CRD handling (both crds/ directory and optional template) must be established first since it affects how the operator is installed and upgraded.

**Affected Areas:**
- charts/memcached-operator/Chart.yaml
- charts/memcached-operator/values.yaml
- charts/memcached-operator/templates/_helpers.tpl
- charts/memcached-operator/crds/
- charts/memcached-operator/templates/crd-template.yaml

**Size:** üèóÔ∏è large **Category:** infrastructure **Priority:** high ## Open Questions All prior questions have been resolved by the user's selections: | # | Decision | Choice | |---|----------|--------| | 1 | CRD upgrade strategy | Both: `crds/` for install + optional template for managed upgrades | | 2 | Distribution format | OCI registry via GHCR | | 3 | Kustomize coexistence | Coexist ‚Äî Kustomize stays as-is, chart is additive | | 4 | Namespace-scope RBAC | Chart passes `watchNamespaces` as container arg only | **1. OCI push trigger and versioning?** The user chose GHCR over GitHub Pages. This changes the release pipeline. 1. **(Recommended) Push on Git tag matching `chart/v*` pattern** ‚Äî Decouples chart releases from operator image releases. Uses `helm push` to `oci://ghcr.io//charts/memcached-operator`. Chart version in `Chart.yaml` must match tag. 2. **Push on every operator release tag `v*`** ‚Äî Ties chart version 1:1 to operator version. Simpler but prevents independent chart-only fixes (e.g. template bug with same operator version). **2. CRD template opt-in: separate value key or reuse `crds/` directory presence?** The user chose "both" for CRD strategy. The optional template needs a toggle. 1. **(Recommended) `crds.managedByHelm: false` in values.yaml** ‚Äî When `true`, CRD renders as a template (upgradeable via `helm upgrade`). Default `false` uses the `crds/` directory convention. Clear intent. 2. **`crds.install: true` + `crds.keepOnUninstall: true`** ‚Äî Mirrors cert-manager's pattern. Two knobs instead of one. ## Summary Package the memcached-operator as a Helm chart under `charts/memcached-operator/`, translating all existing Kustomize manifests from `config/` into parameterized Helm templates. The chart exposes toggles for optional components (webhooks, cert-manager, ServiceMonitor, NetworkPolicy) and all deployment parameters as `values.yaml` entries. CRDs live in `crds/` for standard Helm install behavior, with an optional template path for managed upgrades. CI validates with `helm lint`, `chart-testing`, and `helm-unittest`. Releases publish to GHCR as an OCI artifact. ## Scope **Included:** - `charts/memcached-operator/Chart.yaml` ‚Äî `appVersion` tracks operator version, `type: application` - `charts/memcached-operator/values.yaml` ‚Äî all tunables - Templates for: Deployment, ServiceAccount, ClusterRole/ClusterRoleBinding, LeaderElection Role/RoleBinding, Metrics roles, MutatingWebhookConfiguration, ValidatingWebhookConfiguration, Webhook Service, cert-manager Issuer + Certificate, ServiceMonitor, NetworkPolicy - CRD in `crds/` directory (Helm-native install) **plus** optional CRD template gated by `crds.managedByHelm` - Conditional rendering via `webhook.enabled`, `certmanager.enabled`, `serviceMonitor.enabled`, `networkPolicy.enabled` - `_helpers.tpl` with standard label/name/selector helpers matching existing `app.kubernetes.io/name` conventions - `helm-unittest` test suite under `charts/memcached-operator/tests/` - CI job in `.github/workflows/ci.yml`: `helm lint`, `ct lint`, `helm-unittest` - Release workflow publishing OCI artifact to `oci://ghcr.io//charts/memcached-operator` via `helm push` - Chart README with install/upgrade/CRD-upgrade instructions **Excluded (YAGNI):** - **Kustomize removal or migration** ‚Äî existing `make deploy` workflow and E2E tests remain untouched - **Namespace-scoped RBAC generation per watched namespace** ‚Äî user manages externally; chart only passes `--watch-namespaces` arg - **Helm hooks for CRD lifecycle** ‚Äî `crds/` + optional template covers both strategies without hook complexity - **GitHub Pages distribution** ‚Äî user chose OCI/GHCR; can add Pages later if needed - **Helm chart for the Memcached workload itself** ‚Äî chart manages only the operator - **`kube-linter` or `polaris` integration** ‚Äî separate concern ## Visualization ```mermaid flowchart TD subgraph Chart["charts/memcached-operator/"] CY["Chart.yaml"] VY["values.yaml"] subgraph crds["crds/"] CRD["memcacheds CRD

`appVersion` tracks operator version; `type: application` - **`values.yaml`** ‚Äî `image.repository`/`tag`, `replicaCount`, `resources`, `webhook.enabled`, `certmanager.enabled`, `serviceMonitor.enabled`, `networkPolicy.enabled`, `watchNamespaces`, `leaderElection.enabled`, `rbac.create`, `crds.managedByHelm` - **`templates/_helpers.tpl`** ‚Äî Standard label/name/selector helpers matching existing `app.kubernetes.io/name: memcached-operator` convention from `config/` - **`templates/deployment.yaml`** ‚Äî Translates `config/manager/manager.yaml`; parameterized image, replicas, resources, security context, args (including `--watch-namespaces`) - **`templates/rbac/`** ‚Äî ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, ServiceAccount, leader-election Role/RoleBinding, metrics auth roles ‚Äî gated by `rbac.create` - **`templates/webhook/`** ‚Äî MutatingWebhookConfiguration + ValidatingWebhookConfiguration + Service ‚Äî gated by `webhook.enabled` - **`templates/certmanager/`** ‚Äî Issuer + Certificate ‚Äî gated by `certmanager.enabled` (implies `webhook.enabled`) - **`templates/servicemonitor.yaml`** ‚Äî Prometheus ServiceMonitor ‚Äî gated by `serviceMonitor.enabled` - **`templates/networkpolicy.yaml`** ‚Äî Metrics ingress NetworkPolicy ‚Äî gated by `networkPolicy.enabled` - **`crds/`** ‚Äî `memcached.c5c3.io_memcacheds.yaml` copied from `config/crd/bases/`; Helm installs on first install only - **`templates/crd-template.yaml`** ‚Äî Same CRD rendered as template when `crds.managedByHelm: true`; enables `helm upgrade` to update CRDs - **`tests/`** ‚Äî `helm-unittest` YAML test files validating default rendering + all toggle combinations - **CI job** ‚Äî New `helm-lint` job in `ci.yml`: `helm lint`, `ct lint --all`, `helm-unittest` - **Release workflow** ‚Äî New `.github/workflows/helm-release.yml`: on `chart/v*` tag, runs `helm package` + `helm push` to `oci://ghcr.io//charts/memcached-operator`
